question: Amnion is made up of
exp: Amnion is made up of Amniogenic cells+ Somatopleuric cells

question: Placenta develops from
exp: Development of placenta: - Placenta has two components : Maternal & Fetal When the blastocyst attaches to uterus in endometrium, the endometrium is called as decidua which is of three types: - Decidua basalis , Decidua capsularis & Decidua parietalis. Fetus will also have some chorionic membrane developing leading to villi formation : Chorion Frondosum & Chorion laeve. Chorion laeve will disappear. Chorionic Frondosum persists & contributes to placenta along with Decidua Basalis .

question: Which of the following are components of the definitive chorion?
exp: The definitive chorion consists of three components: extraembryonic somatic mesoderm, cytotrophoblast, and syncytiotrophoblast. The chorion defines the chorionic cavity in which the embryoblast is suspended and is vital in the formation of the placenta.
opd: Extraembryonic somatic mesoderm, cytotrophoblast, and syncytiotrophoblast

question: Which of the following does not pass through the primitive umbilical ring?
exp: The amnion does not pass through the primitive umbilical ring. As craniocaudal folding occurs, the amnion becomes the outer covering of the umbilical cord.

question: Connecting Stalk forms
exp: Connecting Stalk forms primary Umbilical Cord .

question: The intervillous space of the placenta contains
exp: The intervillous space contains only maternal blood as the spiral aeries of the endometrium penetrate the outer cytotrophoblast shell.

question: Teiary chorionic villi develop at?
exp: Teiary chorionic villi develop at day 17-21

question: Chorion is:-
exp: Somatotropic mesoderm along with cytotrophoblast is called chorion. Somatopleuric layer lines the cyto-trophoblast and amnion; and splanchno pleuric layer covers the primary yolk sac. The extra embryonic coelom divides the extra embryonic mesoderm into somatopleuric and splanchnopleuric layers.
